messages.message:
Heyo frontend peeps! I just finished creating a new aihub cluster dedicated specifically to running cypress pre-merge tests with crafting, which should help with the 502 errors we've observed recently

I haven't gone through the full aihub setup yet, but I've added the following users as admins (instabase email, default password is `Changeme123!`)
• @Serena 
• @Jessica 
• @CJ 
• @Travis 
• @Arjun 
• @Xindi Xu 
• @Weiming Wu 
If anyone finds time to help configure everything required by the cypress tests it would be immensely appreciated -- I won't adjust the cypress sandbox configuration until I get the all-clear signal from y'all, so tests will continue running against crafting-aihub until then!
What's the url to the new env?

https://crafting-cyp.test.instabase.com

sorry about that, I'm asking the icc team to help update the displayed url from `internal` to `test`!
Nice! I got in. I can prioritize setting up a shared org to unblock other set ups!
:blob-dance: sweet, thank you so much Xindi!! I'll get a ticket going with IT for the openai key in a bit as well

@danny.lan i want to make you a site admin, but i think i’m not supposed to create an account for you in the Admin app :sweat_smile:

@Xindi Xu how should users create accounts for themselves?
I’ve added a member to an org in AIHub settings (which creates that user), then used a site admin account to turn on Site Admin privelages in Admin.
ok i’ll wait for the org that xindi’s creating then
openai api keys are auto provisioned now, very cool!
So this sandbox does not share db with crafting sandbox?
I'm going to create cypress users using `<mailto:support-testing@instabase.com|support-testing@instabase.com>` emails.
yes, this sandbox does not share a db with crafting-aihub @Udit
@sean.donohoe does the new sandbox not using the same env patches as `https://crafting-aihub.test.instabase.com/`? For example, MFA is required in the new env
ah okay, l’ll have to setup all the apps + deployments + users required for review tests then before this is used. Let me know when you setup the orgs plus the cypress shared workspace!
I'm going to add patches to disable mfa for now, but we need to make sure we use the correct env patch sets
@sean.donohoe also, the sandbox seems to be in the ST aihub mode, but it should be in MT aihub mode since we need to replicate aihub.instabase.com (http://aihub.instabase.com) env
I have created an org and added all the users we need for cypress CI. Search for "Cypress CI" in 1pass.

@Xindi Xu I think we'll need to duplicate the patches, since this is an entirely new cluster -- do you know of any docs for converting from ST to MT? I was told we should only be creating ST clusters from icc now :neutral_face:

>  I was told we should only be creating ST clusters from icc now 
I think that's somewhat correct–all customer's env should be ST. crafting cypress test envs are an exception. We can start a thread in <#C027EPGM2UQ|> on this. We at least need to unset the env vars in this doc:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1BCElRLwzkOBn3w1QyrLCZ0LpRplEez1g4ageFBaWO-4/edit#heading=h.hel6uifqpoh4
btw thank you @Xindi Xu for jumping in to help set up this new env!! i’m hopeful that this will make Cypress more stable! :pray:

> I think we'll need to duplicate the patches, since this is an entirely new cluster
looks like I'm wrong on this, I can't find any patches specific to crafting-aihub under deployment-configs/ :thinking_face: would the ST setup disqualify this cluster from receiving the usual ones?
yea, that's what i'm unsure of. started a thread here: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C01N7DV1137/p1717717506764999
